hotspots.label: Whip Scorpion
hotspots.fact: This is a whip scorpion, a harmless arachnid that looks scary but cannot hurt humans. Despite their name, they are not true scorpions and have no venom!

hotspots.label: Tree Bark Texture
hotspots.fact: Tree bark protects the living wood underneath from insects, weather, and damage. The rough texture and grooves you see help water drain off and provide hiding places for tiny creatures.

hotspots.label: Lichen Growth
hotspots.fact: Lichen is a combination of fungus and algae living together. These colorful patches help break down bark over many years and are a sign of clean, healthy air!

hotspots.label: Moss and Algae
hotspots.fact: Mosses and algae grow on bark because they love moisture and shade. These plants help create a miniature ecosystem where insects and other small creatures can live.
